@description.name: @description
@description.body: Utility module to give some support to work with functions.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a debounced version of the given callback. The execution of the callback is delayed by the given delay and after no events were triggered anymore. This mechanism is very useful for event handling: only after a specified delay the event should be handled (e.g. at keyboard input by the user) to prevent flooding the handler with a large amounts of events.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
callback {Function} the callback which should be executed after the given delay
 if the wrapper method is *not* called during this delay.
@param.description:
the callback which should be executed after the given delay
 if the wrapper method is *not* called during this delay.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: immediate {Boolean?} whether to run the callback at the beginning and then debounce, default is false
@param.description: whether to run the callback at the beginning and then debounce, default is false

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Function} a wrapper function which shields the given callback function
@return.description: a wrapper function which shields the given callback function

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a throttled version of the given callback. The execution of the callback is throttled which means it is only executed in the given interval. This mechanism is very useful for event handling: only in specified intervals the event should be handled (e.g. at resize of the browser window) to prevent flooding the handler with a large amounts of events. As default the leading and trailing calls are executed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: callback {Function} the callback which should be executed in the given interval
@param.description: the callback which should be executed in the given interval

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map} the keys are leading and trailing to control the executing of the callback precisely. Default values are true for both options.
@param.description: the keys are leading and trailing to control the executing of the callback precisely. Default values are true for both options.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Function} a wrapper function which shields the given callback function
@return.description: a wrapper function which shields the given callback function
